contentrichtext.text: {{History of Japan|Shoso-in.jpg| Image explanation = [[Shōsōin]]}} {{nihongo|'''Kōgen'''|康元|}} was a {{nihongo|[[Japanese era name]]|年号,|''nengō'',|lit. "year name"}} after ''[[Kenchō]]'' and before ''[[Shōka]].'' This period spanned the years from October 1256 to March 1257.<ref>Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "''Kōgen''" in [http://books.google.com/books?id=p2QnPijAEmEC&pg=PA542&dq= ''Japan encyclopedia'', p. 542;] n.b., Louis-Frédéric is pseudonym of Louis-Frédéric Nussbaum, ''see'' [http://dispatch.opac.ddb.de/DB=4.1/PPN?PPN=128842709 Deutsche Nationalbibliothek Authority File].</ref> The reigning emperor was {{nihongo|[[Emperor Go-Fukakusa|Go-Fukakusa]]''-tennō''|後深草天皇}}.<ref>Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP9&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA248,M1 ''Annales des empereurs du Japon'', pp. 248-253;] Varley, H. Paul. (1980). ''Jinnō Shōtōki.'' p. 231-232.</ref> ==Change of era== * '''1256''' {{nihongo|''Kōgen gannen''|康元元年}}: The new era name was created to mark an event or a number of events. The previous era ended and a new one commenced in ''Kenchō'' 8. ==Events of the ''Kōgen'' era== * '''September 1, 1256''' (''Kōgen 1, 11th day of the 8th month'')<!-- NengoCalc 康元一年八月十一日 -->: Kujō Yoritsune, also known as [[Fujiwara Yoritsune]], died at the age of 39 years.<ref name="t252">Titsingh, [http://books.google.com/books?id=18oNAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP9&dq=nipon+o+dai+itsi+ran#PRA1-PA252,M1 p. 252.]</ref> * '''October 14, 1256''' (''Kōgen 1, 24th day of the 9th month'')<!-- NengoCalc 康元一年九月二十五日 -->: Yoritsune's son and successor as Kamakura shogun, Kujō Yoritsugu, also known as [[Fujiwara Yoritsugu]], died at the age of 18 years.<ref name="t252"/> ==Notes== {{reflist|1}} ==References== * Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric and Käthe Roth.
